intro: Spatholobus riparius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal areas and riverbanks. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense spikes, and it is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. The species is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
